snippet: The euro zone economy shows signs of stabilizing, the E.C.B. chief said, while the Bank of England kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged amid a dismal economic outlook.
abstract: European Central Bank leaves its main interest rate at record low of 0.75 percent, as president Mario Draghi points to signs of stabilization across the continent; Bank of England remains wary, deciding to hold to its dismal outlook for 2013.

byline.original: By JACK EWING and JULIA WERDIGIER
byline.contributor: Jack Ewing reported from Frankfurt and Julia Werdigier from London.

lead_paragraph: The euro zone economy shows signs of stabilizing, the E.C.B. chief said, while the Bank of England kept its benchmark interest rate unchanged amid a dismal economic outlook.

headline.seo: Euro Zone Economy Shows Some Positive Signs
headline.main: European Central Bank Leaves Key Rate Unchanged
headline.print_headline: Europe Sees Positive Economic Signs, but Britain Remains Wary
